title: Foreign Language Instructional Design Integrating Self-Regulated Learning Strategies with Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic foreign language learning experience and fundamental educator competencies
context.additional_context: A foreign language education program for pre-service and in-service teachers combining flipped learning and self-regulated learning strategies in a BYOD environment, with personalized progress tracking and project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can improve proficiency (speaking, reading, writing, grammar) in target foreign languages by 20% using self-regulated learning strategies in flipped learning environments
Learners can analyze pre-learning materials through a digital platform and develop a self-directed inquiry plan for discussion topics.
Learners submit a flipped learning lesson design applicable to real classroom settings through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
